column4: I have some questions about .mkv playback containing what i think is VC-1 codec not playing in mplayer / vlc/ xbmc  is this the right place to be asking them ?
if it doesn't play in mplayer its most likely un-supported. mplayer has been able to play anything I have thrown at it. If it can play it, its most likely a bad encoding.
*if it can't play it, its a bad encoding
Thanks for the reply.  I got the file from somewhere that confirms its working.  When i try and play the file using the mplayer test.mkv command it starts loading the file and then says Seek failed.
Also when trying to play it in XBMC it trys to play it as a audio file, but i think that is because XBMC does not support VC-1
in my experience if it says seek failed it normally means that its a incomplete file.
or its missing some sort of important headder
,bluekaJ  But don't worry the questions dont end there..
I have played 1080p mkv files .. They work fine but use a bit of cpu. You really need a fast computer to keep up with the codec
Surely it would be some sort of codec problem if they work fine in xbmc ?
i run XBMC in the same session, not in its only session
most likely btw where are you getting these videos from anyway
I get them from Usenet
its possible that the format is just messed up on thoes piticular files.

i am just testing between all the vieo files i have.  It seems any 720p or under works fine in vlc but anything 1080p isn't.  In XBMC everything plays.  Is there a cache setting that is maybe choking me ? since i am streaming these off  mount NAS drives
alright .. try  mplayer -cache 80000 /path/to/file
I stream 1080p off of NFS and it works fine .. usually 1 to 2 MB/s though of data
Takes ages to type the paths.  is there some sort of auto fill ?  like type the first part in then let the terminal autofill ?
tab and dubble tab
Cheers.  Nope its still laggy
Less Laggy..
tab fills in ... dubble tab lists everything int that directory that is under the characters you already have down
my experience is that broken formats usually spit out a lot of junk on the terminal about broken crc or somthing like that .. and dont play right with a lot of skips and glitches
if its not the format try the -frameskip option to speed up the sound.
